revision.comment: Notification of altered sources needing review #IABot
revision.text: {{ARBPIA}} {{WikiProject Israel|class=C|importance=mid}} {{WPMILHIST|class=C|B1=n|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|Middle-Eastern=yes}} }} ==Katyushas?== There is no "107-mm" Katyusha rocket. The rockets on the ship appear to have been 107 mm Type 63 rockets from China. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/124.187.31.164|124.187.31.164]] ([[User talk:124.187.31.164|talk]]) 05:38, 17 November 2009 (UTC) ==Proposed merger of MV Francop into this article== The proposer of the merger has not provided any rationale here for the proposal. However, I '''oppose''' the merger. The ship is notable enough to sustain an article of its own, and would have been if the incident hadn't occurred. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 08:11, 8 November 2009 (UTC) * Why do you claim is it notable on it's own ? Can you provide a citation ? [[User:Marokwitz|Marokwitz]] ([[User talk:Marokwitz|talk]]) 08:35, 8 November 2009 (UTC) :Peculiar. This is bordering on news event only. The ship is definitely NN (nothing shows otherwise), and this event is so far just a single event, unles it can be tied to the ship seized by Yemen now. I saw delete both, move to a paragraph somewhere if anything develops out of this. --[[User:Shuki|Shuki]] ([[User talk:Shuki|talk]]) 11:28, 8 November 2009 (UTC) :: I think this operation is notable historical event, see also [[Operation Noah's Ark]] [[User:Marokwitz|Marokwitz]] ([[User talk:Marokwitz|talk]]) 12:05, 8 November 2009 (UTC) :::Ships generally meet [[WP:N]] through coverage by websites such as Miramar Ship index, Fakta om Fartyg, Det Norske Veritas etc. Even though no article had been written until the ship was detained, there would still have been enough verifiable information to write an article of at least C class on the ship. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 15:59, 8 November 2009 (UTC) *As with [[USS Liberty (AGTR-5)]], there should be an article on the ship, dealing with the ship characteristics and a brief discussion of the incident preceded by a link to a separate article on the incident. Cf. [[HMS Bounty]]; vessels used in voyages of exploration are often handled that way as well. That will also avoid the confusion of two infoboxes. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 16:26, 8 November 2009 (UTC) ::Military ships are a bit more significant than NN medium size generic container carriers which number in the thousands if not more around the world. --[[User:Shuki|Shuki]] ([[User talk:Shuki|talk]]) 16:49, 8 November 2009 (UTC) :::The ship is a generic freighter. It has ABSOLUTELY NO notability except in the context of this military operation. I vote for it to be merged immediately.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 17:32, 8 November 2009 (UTC) ::::I do think that the detail regarding the operation should be placed in the article devoted to that operation (which now looks to be shorter than the separate section within the ship article). But a separate article on the ship is still warranted. In any event there is no need to do anything immediately (after less than 10 hours of discussion); let's wait for consensus to develop. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 17:40, 8 November 2009 (UTC) :::::ShamWow, if you feel that this ship has absolutely no notability other than the incident, why not propose it at [[WP:AfD]]? I for one am confident that it will survive an AfD debate. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 18:19, 8 November 2009 (UTC) IMO, AFD is pointless and a merge is inevitable. The argument is what is merged into what. one article into the other, or both into [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701]]. I posted it onto the WP:ISRAEL page to generate more traffic. I also remind you, only 10 hours have gone by. First I suggest some structure. to follow. --[[User:Shuki|Shuki]] ([[User talk:Shuki|talk]]) 19:43, 8 November 2009 (UTC) :Francop should be merged into Operation Four Species, which should be be kept as its own article. In coverage of the incident, there has been barely any mention of UNSCR 1701, but it surely deserves to be included in that article.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 19:52, 8 November 2009 (UTC) Here's a few examples of treatment elsewhere. ''Piracy off Somalia'' *[[MV Maersk Alabama]], [[Maersk Alabama hijacking]] *[[USS Cape St. George (CG-71)]] and [[USS Gonzalez (DDG-66)]], [[Action of 18 March 2006]] *[[MV Danica White]], [[Action of 3 June 2007]] *[[Carré d'As IV]], [[September 16, 2008 incident off Somalia]] In other cases, there typically is an article for the ship, where the incident also is described. ''Voyages of exploration'' *[[RRS Discovery]], [[Discovery Expedition]] *[[Endurance (1912 ship)]], [[Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition]] *[[Fram]] and [[Nansen's Fram expedition]], [[Amundsen's South Pole expedition]] *[[Nimrod (ship)]], [[Nimrod Expedition]] Once a ship achieves notablity, an article on that vessel typically will appear. That article contains an infobox, giving ownership and technical data on the ship. Often a separate article on the incident will appear; and each article links to the other. Folks interested in ships can follow the link to the ship article; those interested only in the incident need not do so. And the interests of all are served. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 20:39, 8 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Support''' - NN Generic shipping ship and WP:ONEEVENT. I also have my doubts about the legitimacy of a standalone '4 species' event which is more related to the aftermath of [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701]] and the Israelis finally loosing patience watching Iran continue supplying weapons to Hezbollah and not some ground breaking operation. --[[User:Shuki|Shuki]] ([[User talk:Shuki|talk]]) 21:08, 8 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' - Notability as understood for ships is not a problem here, see countless articles on ships of this size, whatever their type. The event it has been caught up in merely adds further notability to this ship and her career, as with [[MV Maersk Alabama]], [[MV Danica White]], [[Carré d'As IV]], [[MV Golden Nori]], [[MV Faina]], [[MV Delight]], [[MV Stolt Strength]], etc, etc. No opinion on what should be done with the [[Operation Four Species]] article, but no justification for a merge has been made other than saying that articles on merchant ships are non-notable - 'The ship is a generic freighter. It has ABSOLUTELY NO notability' - which is an opinion, not a reason. This is all the more flawed since by the media attention and coverage of this international incident, the ship has become especially notable. [[User:Benea|Benea]] ([[User talk:Benea|talk]]) 14:13, 9 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Support''' - The article on the ship is very short, I suggest making the ship a section UNTIL it becomes well "articleified", and then the ship section in this article can be condensed and the ship article can be restored. [[User:Hamtechperson|Hamtechperson]] [[User talk:Hamtechperson|Repeater]] 16:56, 9 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Oppose''', for reasons set forth above. A separate article on the vessel comports with prior practice. Given how incidents have been handled, an article on the incident is also merited. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 18:06, 9 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Support''' - I don't see how the MV Francop article adds value to Wikipedia. Wikipedia is not an encyclopedia but on things that are notable. It seems that the Operation Four Species would clearly encompass basically all of the information in the ship's article. It is also doubtful that most people know the name of this operation. Instead, they would search for the name of the ship and be directed to the wrong article. That does not seem like a desired outcome.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 21:04, 9 November 2009 (UTC) ::Additionally, the article on a similar seizure of Iranian weapons the high seas is titled by the operation name ([[Operation Noah's Ark]]), rather than by the name of ship, the [[Karine A]], which redirects to the operations page. There should be consistency between the articles of these two similar military operations.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 21:08, 9 November 2009 (UTC) :::Agreed, there should be consistency. {{MV|Karine A}} article needs creating. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 21:58, 9 November 2009 (UTC) :::[[User:Kablammo]] has given a long list of articles which if anything indicate that if consistency is to be achieved, the ship article should be created, not merged into an article on one event the ship took part in. [[User:Benea|Benea]] ([[User talk:Benea|talk]]) 01:03, 10 November 2009 (UTC) :'''Comment''' to Benea. IMO, the Somali hijacked ship articles are fascinating in that they are all not worthy of separate articles and should be merged into one list. Don't we know that the hijackings are a dime a dozen in the last couple of years? Not that I'm into going after justice, but I would open an AfD merge of all in one yearly article - ex: 2008 maritime hijackings. --[[User:Shuki|Shuki]] ([[User talk:Shuki|talk]]) 22:09, 9 November 2009 (UTC) ::There again is this 'they are all not worthy of separate articles' opinion. I could add to the list [[SS Empire Bison]], [[SS Lokoja Palm]], [[MV Target]], [[SS Hewsang]], [[PS Monarch]], [[MS Femund II]], [[SS Stanbell]], [[MV Western Lady III]], [[MV Devonair Belle]], [[MV Athelqueen (1942)]], etc, with no connection whatsoever with Somalian hijackings. Open a collective AFD if you feel so inclined. Otherwise this is still just your opinion, which is not reflected by long-standing consensus with regards to merchant ships of whatever type and use. [[User:Benea|Benea]] ([[User talk:Benea|talk]]) 01:03, 10 November 2009 (UTC) :'''Comment''' Should this article even be known by the name of the Israeli operation to seize the ship? It's doubtful that many outside of Israel know that the operation went by this name. Could it make more sense to call the article the "MV Francop Affair"? And "Operation Noah's Ark" as the "Karine A Affair"? I don't feel that strongly on this issue, just something to consider. "Operation Four Species" is pretty obscure.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 23:08, 9 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' merger; ships are generally considered to have automatic notability. Following Shuki's and Shamwow's logic, [[SS Minnesotan]], an FA, is just another "generic freighter" and doesn't merit an article. You could extend that line of reasoning to any one of the [[:Category:Wickes class destroyers|''Wickes'' class destroyers]]; the USN built 111 of them, surely they're just as generic as ''Francop'' or ''Karina A''. As for the issue of this article's name, I'd suggest something other than the current title. All of the international media cited in the article (BBC, AP, etc.) don't use the operation name. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 02:16, 10 November 2009 (UTC) :In jest, it seems like the opposition here belongs to the crazy cult that is Wikiproject ships. Back to the argument, the [[SS Minnesotan]], given its lengthy history, is clearly more notable than the MV Francop. If you guys are really that bored and desperately searching for something to add to Wikiproject ships, knock yourself out. But it really seems to add little value to Wikipedia and is a serious overstretch.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 04:06, 10 November 2009 (UTC) ::ShamWow, you seem to have got it. WPSHIPS considers the ship notable, WPIsrael doesn't. How about we agree to differ? Hopefully Francop has another 20 years or so ahead of her yet. I'd say the real issue here is how much to mention of Operation Four Seasons in the article about the ship, and whether or not that article should be a stand-alone article. I have no strong opinion on either of those arguements. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 08:31, 10 November 2009 (UTC) :::I'll agree to that. Keep the MV Francop article as well as this article, which may potentially be renamed to the MV Francop Affair. I think the MV Francop article should not go to deeply into the details of the military operation, in order not to interfere with the main article on it.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 14:06, 10 November 2009 (UTC) ::::Hmmm, looks like peace could be about to break out. [[file:smiley.svg|15px]] [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 17:00, 10 November 2009 (UTC) *'''Comment''' No one has yet to produce any acceptable/accepted guideline for judging the notability of ships. I stand by my comment about the Somali hijackings, and certainly SS Minnesotan is a bad example cuz it is definitely notable. Not to insult anyone on WP:SHIPS, but there are many articles in [[:Category:Container ships]] that are orphans, and others that would otherwise be orphans are linked to user pages. Above the orphans, we have other ships that are clearly WP:ONEVENT. Is one event enough to make a container ship notable? As for the name of the operation, Shamwow, I think that I might agree. Maybe that name is legitimate on the Israeli WP, but then again, I do not know policy of WP:MILITARY for naming articles and perhaps they should be consulted. --[[User:Shuki|Shuki]] ([[User talk:Shuki|talk]]) 22:56, 10 November 2009 (UTC) :Agreed on the production of guidelines for the notability of ships. It still clearly falls under [[WP:ONEEVENT]], despite [[User talk:Mjroots|talk]] hope that "Francop has another 20 years or so ahead of her yet." Ultimately though, I'm getting tired of this marginal debate.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 23:48, 10 November 2009 (UTC) ::I've replied at [[WT:SHIPS]] re notability of ships. The military project you mean is [[WP:MILHIST]]. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 05:03, 11 November 2009 (UTC) :::Let's just end this already. Keep the MV Francop article, but will have to have a disclaimer at the top redirecting users to the Operation Four Species/MV Francop Affair. I believe it will also be appropriate to change the article name to the MV Francop Affair.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 16:53, 11 November 2009 (UTC) ::::No objection to that proposal in principle, the arms seizure can be paraphrased in the MV Francop article, with a {{tl|main}} header in that section. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 18:09, 11 November 2009 (UTC) :::::As long as the MV Francop's history revolves around this operation, I would argue that the header needs to be at the top of page. E.g. For the MV Francop Affair see... ::::::It's time to put this to bed. Move the O4S article, and add a hatnote to the MV Francop article. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 16:06, 13 November 2009 (UTC) == Article name change == See discussion above. Should article be renamed the MV Francop Affair or the Francop Affair? And by the naming conventions, would affair be capitalized or lower-case? Other ideas welcome.[[User:ShamWow|ShamWow]] ([[User talk:ShamWow|talk]]) 22:40, 14 November 2009 (UTC) :Francop Affair would be a good title. Capitalized as it's a Proper Noun phrase, like Operation Four Species. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 09:33, 15 November 2009 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Francop Affair]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=702277140 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20110506234851/http://dover.idf.il/IDF/English/News/today/09/11/0505.htm to http://dover.idf.il/IDF/English/News/today/09/11/0505.htm When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 15:51, 29 January 2016 (UTC)
